question: A current of 3 A is passed through a molten calcium salt for 1 hr 47 min 13 sec. The mass of calcium deposited is: (Molar mass of <katex>$Ca=40 \ g \ mol^{-1}$</katex>)
explanation: Time t = 6433 s. Charge Q = 3 * 6433 = 19299 C. Moles electrons = 19299/96500 = 0.2 mol. Ca needs 2e-. Moles Ca = 0.1. Mass = 0.1 * 40 = 4g.
